result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Parez

defendant.name: Parez, Christopher J
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:44 AM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 21CF1639, 22CF153 and 22CM155. 
Defense does not object 
Court dismisses and reads into Cases 21CF1639, 22CF153 and 22CM155.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:57 AM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Tapia requests this matter be set for a status of preliminary hearing with the defendants other cases before the Trial Court.  Attorney Tapia further states they will likely request a sooner date before the Judge as they have an offer for the defendant to enter DTC Court.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J Parez
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2022)
Prior: 477 W Main St,#10, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:53 PM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Menden states Attorney Tapia has requested this matter be put on for an adjourned initial appearance date on March 3 with the defendants other new matter.  The Court will set this for a status date with 22CF263 on March 3, 2022 at 8:15 am.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
changed to Judge Bugenhagen to match all existing cases
